main.java.embl.rieslab.emu.micromanager.mmproperties

Class MMProperty<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.embl.rieslab.emu.micromanager.mmproperties.MMProperty<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the Micro-manager property.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConfigGroupAsMMProperty, FloatMMProperty, IntegerMMProperty, StringMMProperty

    public abstract class MMProperty<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract wrapper for a Micro-manager device property. This class allows retrieving and modifying the value of a device property, within its limits, or allowed values, as defined by Micro-manager. Each MMProperty is identified by a hash "deviceLabel-propertyLabel" where deviceLabel is the label of the device holding the property and propertyLabel is the label of the property.
    Author:
    Joran Deschamps

      • getCore

        protected mmcorej.CMMCore getCore()

      • getValue

        public T getValue()
        Returns the current value of the device property. This method calls Micro-Manager CMMCore.
        Returns:
        Current value.

      • getStringValue

        public java.lang.String getStringValue()
        Returns the current value of the device property as a String. This method calls Micro-Manager CMMCore.
        Returns:
        Current String value.

      • setStringValue

        public void setStringValue(java.lang.String stringval,
                  UIProperty source)
        Sets the value of the device property and updates all parent UIProperties. This method is called by a parent UIProperty, and the source is excluded from the notification (using notifyListeners(UIProperty, String)). The method calls Micro-Manager CMMCore.
        Parameters:
        stringval - New value.
        source - UIProperty at the origin of the update.

      • hasLimits

        public boolean hasLimits()
        Checks if the MMProperty has limits.
        Returns:
        True if the device property has limits, false otherwise.

      • hasAllowedValues

        public boolean hasAllowedValues()
        Checks if the Micro-manager property has allowed values.
        Returns:
        True if the device property has allowed values, false otherwise.

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        Checks if the Micro-manager property is read-only.
        Returns:
        True if the device property is read only, false otherwise.

      • getAllowedValues

        public T[] getAllowedValues()
        Returns the array of allowed values. This array can be null if the MMProperty has no allowed value.
        Returns:
        Allowed values, null if it has none.

      • getStringAllowedValues

        public java.lang.String[] getStringAllowedValues()
        Returns the array of allowed values as Strings. In particular, the array is of size 0 if it has no allowed value.
        Returns:
        Allowed values as Strings, array of size 0 if it has none.

      • setMax

        public void setMax(T val)
        Sets a maximum to the value of the device property. The maximum should be smaller than the upper limit. Maximum value is only used in device property that have limits. If these conditions are not met, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        val - Maximum value.

      • setMin

        public void setMin(T val)
        Sets a minimum to the value of the device property. The minimum should be larger than the lower limit. Minimum value is only used in device property that have limits. If these conditions are not met, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        val - Minimum value.

      • getStringMax

        public java.lang.String getStringMax()
        Returns the maximum value as a String. If the device property doesn't have limits, then the method returns null.
        Returns:
        Maximum value, or null if the device property doesn't have limits.

      • getStringMin

        public java.lang.String getStringMin()
        Returns the minimum value has a String. If the device property doesn't have limits, then the method returns null.
        Returns:
        Minimum value, or null if the device property doesn't have limits.

      • getMax

        public T getMax()
        Returns the maximum value. If the device property doesn't have limits, then the method returns null.
        Returns:
        Maximum value, or null if the device property doesn't have limits.

      • getMin

        public T getMin()
        Returns the minimum value. If the device property doesn't have limits, then the method returns null.
        Returns:
        Minimum value, or null if the device property doesn't have limits.

      • getLowerLimit

        public java.lang.Double getLowerLimit()
        Returns the lower limit. If the device property doesn't have limits, then the method returns null.
        Returns:
        Lower limit value, or null if the device property doesn't have limits.

      • getUpperLimit

        public java.lang.Double getUpperLimit()
        Returns the upper limit. If the device property doesn't have limits, then the method returns null.
        Returns:
        Upper limit value, or null if the device property doesn't have limits.

      • getDeviceLabel

        public java.lang.String getDeviceLabel()
        Returns the parent device label.
        Returns:
        Device label.

      • getMMPropertyLabel

        public java.lang.String getMMPropertyLabel()
        Returns the device property label.
        Returns:
        Property label.

      • getHash

        public java.lang.String getHash()
        Returns the MMProperty hash, which is "{device label}-{property label}" (without brackets).
        Returns:
        Property's hash

      • isInRange

        protected boolean isInRange(java.lang.String strval)
        Tests if the value strval is in range of the device property limits (if applicable).
        Parameters:
        strval - Value
        Returns:
        True if in range, false otherwise.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(UIProperty listener)
        Adds a UIProperty listener to the list of listeners. The UIProperty is then notified when the value of the MMProperty is changed.
        Parameters:
        listener - Parent UIProperty

      • clearAllListeners

        public void clearAllListeners()
        Clear all listeners from the property. Used upon reloading the UI or changing the configuration.

      • notifyListeners

        protected void notifyListeners(UIProperty source,
                   java.lang.String value)
        Notifies the UIProperty parents of a value update, excluding the UIProperty source of the update.
        Parameters:
        source - UIProperty that triggered the update.
        value - Updated value.

      • updateMMProperty

        public void updateMMProperty()
        Updates all listeners with the current MMProperty value.

      • areEqual

        protected abstract boolean areEqual(T val1,
               T val2)
        Tests if equal two values are equal.
        Parameters:
        val1 - First value
        val2 - Second value
        Returns:
        True if equal, false otherwise.

      • isInRange

        protected abstract boolean isInRange(T val)
        Tests if val in the allowed range of the MMProperty, that is to say is smaller than the upper limit and larger than the lower limit. If minimum and maximum have been set to values different than the upper and lower limit, then val is in range if it is contained between the minimum and the maximum. If the property doesn't have limits, this method should return true.
        Parameters:
        val - Value to be checked
        Returns:
        True if in range, false otherwise

      • isAllowed

        protected abstract boolean isAllowed(T val)
        Tests if val is allowed. If the property has neither limits nor allowed values, then the method should return true. If the property has limits, then this method should be equivalent to isInRange().
        Parameters:
        val - Value to be checked
        Returns:
        True if allowed, false otherwise.

      • isStringAllowed

        public boolean isStringAllowed(java.lang.String val)
        Checks if the String val is allowed.
        Parameters:
        val - String to check
        Returns:
        True if val is allowed, false otherwise.
